summary: This is an email chain from March 2020, forwarding a prior email from August 2019. It details the completion of downloading video from DVRs at a location, the installation of a new recording system, and the security protocols for handling the evidence. It involves FBI agents and contractors.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: The email is addressed to this agent, who is part of the Violent Crimes Task Force in the New York Field Office.

persons.name: A7 Agent
persons.context: This agent is tasked with staying with the DVR until the new system is operational and then securing the room with evidence tape.

persons.name: BOP employee
persons.context: This individual remains with the DVR alongside the A7 Agent during the system upgrade.

connections.description: They work together to monitor the DVR and secure the location during the technical upgrade.

events.title: DVR Download and System Replacement
events.description: Video from priority cameras was successfully downloaded from DVRs. A contractor installed a replacement recording system. The A7 Agent and a BOP employee remained to secure the equipment.

events.title: Evidence Collection and Review Staging
events.description: The C19 team was scheduled to arrive to collect the shut-down DVR. Downloaded video was staged for the MXU team to copy, transcode, and prepare for review.

keyFacts: Video evidence was successfully downloaded from DVRs at a location on August 14, 2019, as part of an FBI investigation.
A new recording system was installed to replace the old one, with strict evidence-handling protocols involving FBI agents and a BOP employee.
The downloaded video was prepared for technical processing (transcoding) and review by an MXU team.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI field agents, technical contractors, and evidence collection teams in 2019-2020.
